page.title: 07Red Deer of Exmoor
page.content: Apart from the amazing scenery, one of Exmoor's greatest qualities is its wildlife. The Red Deer for which Exmoor is famous is Britain's largest wild animal. They spend much of the daytime in their woodland haunts, coming out in the early morning and late evening to feed in the open. In early summer they usually graze on the open moorland. Later on in the year they are more likely to be found on farmland on the moorland fringes. Although the Deer can be found almost everywhere on Exmoor, there are probably more on the Somerset side of the county boundary. The chance of a close-up view of these Red Deer is very slight, because they have excellent eyesight and hearing, and a highly developed sense of smell.
